1.name: Chipotle Chicken Burrito Bowl with Cauliflower Rice
instructions: 1. Pulse cauliflower in a food processor until chopped into rice-size pieces.
2. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
3.  Add the cauliflower and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
4. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the cauliflower is softened, about 5 minutes. Cover and keep warm.
5. Position a rack in upper third of oven; preheat broiler to high.
6. Coat a large rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray.
7. Season chicken with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt.
8. Place on the prepared baking sheet and broil for 9 minutes.
9. Meanwhile, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, chipotles, garlic powder and cumin in a small bowl.
10. Turn the chicken over, brush with the chipotle glaze and continue broiling until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest part registers 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes more.
11. Transfer to a clean cutting board and chop into bite-size pieces.
12. Assemble each bowl with 1/2 cup each cauliflower rice, chicken and lettuce, 1/4 cup beans, 1/4 avocado and 1 tablespoon each pico de gallo (or salsa) and cheese. Serve with a lime wedge.

2.name: Meal-Prep Chili-Lime Chicken Bowls
instructions: For Chicken:

1. Whisk together vinegar, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and lime juice. Combine with chicken in a zip lock bag, press the excess air out, and seal. Chill for 30 minutes or up to 8 hours.
2. Preheat grill to medium-high. Use tongs to transfer chicken to the grill, then discard the marinade and bag.
3. Grill for 6-10 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve with lime wedges and cilantro if desired.
Prep for Meal:
1. Combine quinoa and rice; divide among 4 single-serving containers with lids.
2. Top with chicken, jicama, corn, pico de gallo, avocado and cilantro, dividing evenly.
3. Seal the containers and refrigerate for up to 4 days. Serve with lime wedges and hot sauce

3.name: Chicken Caprese Pasta Salad Bowls
instructions: For Basil Vinaigrette:
1. Combine shallot, basil, oil, vinegar, honey (or agave), mustard, pepper and salt in a blender. Puree until smooth.
For Meal:
1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook rotini according to package directions.
2. Drain and rinse under cold running water, then drain again and set aside.
3. Divide spinach among 4 single-serving lidded containers.
4. Top each with 1 cup of the cooked pasta, 1/2 cup tomatoes, 1/2 cup chicken and one-fourth of the mozzarella balls.
5. Divide vinaigrette among 4 small lidded containers and refrigerate.
6. Seal the salad containers and refrigerate for up to 4 days. Dress with the vinaigrette just before serving.

4.name: Rice & Bean Freezer Burritos
instructions: 1. Mash beans in a large bowl with chili powder and cumin until almost smooth.
2. Add cheese, tomatoes, scallions, jalapeños and cilantro; stir to combine.
3. Spread about 1/2 cup of the filling on the bottom third of each tortilla and top with about 1/4 cup rice.
4. Roll up snugly, tucking in the ends as you go.
5. If serving immediately, transfer to a microwave-safe plate, cover with a paper towel and microwave on High until steaming hot, 1 to 2 minutes.
6. If freezing, wrap each burrito in foil. Freeze for up to 3 months.
7. To heat: Remove a burrito from the foil and place on a microwave-safe plate.
8. Cover with a paper towel and microwave on High until steaming hot, 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes.

5.name: Sweet Potato, Kale & Chicken Salad with Peanut Dressing
instructions: To make shredded chicken breast:
1. Place 3/4 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast in a wide saucepan and add enough water to cover.
2. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
3. Reduce heat to maintain a simmer, cover and cook until the chicken registers 165 degrees F at the thickest part, 12 to 15 minutes.
4. Transfer to a cutting board. Let stand until cool enough to handle, then shred.
To make peanut dressing:
1. Whisk peanut butter, tamari (or soy sauce), lime juice, water, honey and garlic in a jar. (lasts 4 days.)
To make the meal:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil; lightly coat with cooking spray. Set aside. Toss sweet potatoes with oil, salt and pepper in a large bowl.

2. Arrange the sweet potatoes in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Roast, turning once, until tender and lightly browned and crispy on the outside, about 20 minutes. Set aside to cool before assembling bowls.
3. Transfer 2 tablespoons peanut dressing into each of 4 small lidded containers; refrigerate for up to 4 days.

4. Divide kale among 4 single-serving containers (about 1 1/2 cups each). Top each with one-fourth of the roasted sweet potatoes and 1/2 cup chicken. Seal the containers and refrigerate for up to 4 days.
5. Just before serving, drizzle each salad with 1 portion of peanut dressing and toss well to coat. Top with 1 tablespoon chopped peanuts.

6.name: Southwest Black-Bean Pasta Salad Bowls
instructions: 1. Heat corn according to package directions; set aside to cool.
2. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain again and toss with the corn; set aside.
3. Slice chicken strips into bite-size pieces; set aside.
4. Divide pico de gallo into 4 small lidded containers and refrigerate. Measure salad dressing into 4 small lidded containers and refrigerate.
(Timesaving tip: You can also carry the bottle of dressing in your lunch bag--or store in the office fridge--and dress when ready to serve.)
5. Divide the corn and pasta mixture among 4 single-serving containers, then top each with one-fourth of the chicken.
6. Seal the containers and refrigerate for up to 4 days. Toss with the dressing just before serving and top with the pico de gallo.

7.name: Bean & Veggie Taco Bowl
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
2. Add bell pepper and onion; cook, stirring often, until the vegetables are crisp-tender, 5 to 8 minutes.
3. Mound rice and beans in a bowl. Top with the vegetables, cheese, pico de gallo (or salsa) and cilantro, if using.
4. Serve with lime wedges and hot sauce, if desired.

8.name: Peanut Butter Sandwich
instructions: 1. apply to bread, then eat

9.name: Mediterranean Wrap
instructions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan. Stir in couscous and remove from the heat. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Set aside.
2. Meanwhile, combine parsley, mint, lemon juice, oil, garlic, 1/8 teaspoon salt and pepper in a small bowl.
3. Toss chicken tenders in a medium bowl with 1 tablespoon of the parsley mixture and the remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt.
4. Place the tenders in a large nonstick skillet and cook over medium heat until cooked though, 3 to 5 minutes per side.
5. Transfer to a clean cutting board. Cut into bite-size pieces when cool enough to handle.
6. Stir the remaining parsley mixture into the couscous along with tomato, cucumber and feda.
7. To assemble wraps, spread about 3/4 cup of the couscous mixture onto each wrap. Divide the chicken among the wraps.
8. Roll the wraps up like a burrito, tucking in the sides to hold the ingredients in. Serve cut in half.

10.name: Spicy Ramen Cup of Noodles
instructions: 1. Place 1/2 tablespoon bouillon paste, 1/2 teaspoon miso, 1/2 teaspoon chili-garlic sauce and 1/2 teaspoon ginger in each of 3 pint-and-a-half size canning jars.
2. Layer 1/4 cup carrot, 1/4 cup mushrooms, 1/2 cup spinach, 2 egg halves and 1/2 cup noodles in each jar.
3. Top each with 1 tablespoon scallions and 1/4 teaspoon sesame seeds. Close the jars. Refrigerate for up to 3 days.
4. To make one jar of noodles, add 1 cup of very hot water to one jar. Close the jar and shake to combine.
5. Microwave uncovered on high in 1-minute increments until steaming hot, 2 to 3 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir before eating.

11.name: Cold Noodle Salad
instructions: 1. In a medium bowl stir together powdered peanut butter and the water. Stir in coconut milk, lime juice, soy sauce, and sriracha sauce until smooth.
2. Add cooked spaghetti, snow pea pods, chicken, red pepper, and cilantro; toss to coat.
3. Transfer to a storage container; sprinkle with green onion.
4. Place peanuts in a small storage container. Cover and chill overnight.
5. Just before serving, sprinkle salad with peanuts.

12.name: Clean-Eating Bento Box Lunch
instructions: 1. Pack snap peas, blueberries, apple, cheese, hummus and crackers in a divided bento-style lunch box or in separate containers with lids.

13.name: Turkey Apple Cheddar Sandwich
instructions: 1. Spread mayonnaise on both slices of bread. Top with turkey, Cheddar and apple.

14.name: Turkey BLT Wraps
instructions: 1. Spread tortilla with mayonnaise. Top with lettuce, turkey, tomato and bacon. Roll closed and cut in half.

15.name: Turkey, Corn & Sun-Dried Tomato Wraps
instructions: 1. Combine corn, tomato, sun-dried tomatoes, oil and vinegar in a medium bowl.
2. Divide turkey among tortillas. Top with equal portions of the corn salad and lettuce. Roll up. Serve the wraps cut in half, if desired.

29.name: Granola Crunch Apple-Peanut Butter Sandwich Wraps

33.name: Pickle Sub Sandwiches with Turkey & Cheddar

34.name: Homemade Peanut Butter and Jelly Uncrustables Sandwich
